\\\Features:\ \\ \
Parser emoting functionality for CNPCs. The emoting library makes use of a behavior database and randomly emotes via the parser. \ If the NPC is using moods, the emoting library will look in the specified database for mood-specific data. See (a link) for further details.\ \ \
\Description:\ \\ \
\\\\The emoting library uses a (group of) specified behavior database(s) to randomly express how an NPC feels (if moods are available), or simply to show it's alive.\ The library uses behavior databases constructed using the NIP extension Lib:NIP:EXT:record (to be documented) -- again, see (a link) for details on this.\ \ \
\NIP properties:\ \\ \ \\
\Property\\\Type\\ \ \Default\\Description\\\
\\ nip:trait:emoting:frequency\\int\ \ \10 \ \\The emoting frequency. By default, the NPC will emote on average every 200th second (i.e. every 3m20s). The lower the value, the more frequent the NPC's emotes will be (every (20 * frequency)'th second, on average). \ \\\
\nip:trait:titles:default\ \ \string*\ \ \\ \ \Default titles to use for men/women when they have none and the behavior uses the \\"(title)\\" keyword. This defaults to \\"sir/ma'am\\" if no property is set whatsoever. The system attempts to grab the property from Data:NIP:system (titles:default) when the emoting library is added to an NPC.\ \ \ \
\nip:behavior:db\ \ \object\ \ \\ \ \The default behavior data object.\ \ \ \
\nip:behavior:\<mood\>\ \ \object\ \ \\ \ \The nip:behavior:*-properties are fetched by the emoting system based on the NPC's mood. If the NPC is in the \\"\HAPPY\\\" mood, the emoting system will attempt to use nip:behavior:happy first, before reverting to nip:behavior:db.\ \ \ \
\nip:trait:hints:db\ \ \object\ \ \\ \ \The standard hints data object, in which rumors are stored. This is optional but inherently supported. When recording behavior, saying \\"!(hint)\\" (thus recording the evoke \\"(hint)\\") will cause an attempt to fetch from the hints data object when that behavior is encountered. Also see +nip command \\"hints\\"\ \ \ \ \ \
\Library script reference(s):\\ \
\\\ \ \ \\
\Merry script\ \\Description\\\
\\ merry:lib:behave\\ \
Shorthand script for the emoting parser,\ \ \::behave(\\\\\$db: \<object\>, \\\\\$mood: \<string\>) \ \\\
\merry:lib:emoting:decide\ \ \Randomly forces the NPC to emote something specified in the appropriate behavior data object(s). The script will not be executed if the NPC is sleeping.\ \ \ \
\merry:lib:handler:emoting:parse\ \ \The BDO (behavior data object) parser. Used by the emoting/DECIDE sig-hook script to perform a random parser move from a specific db/mood.\ \ \ \ \ \\ \ \
